hero.title: Secure Your Supply Chain with Confidence
hero.subtitle: Enterprise-grade supply chain risk management and vendor security assessment platform
hero.description: VendorSoluce helps organizations identify, assess, and mitigate supply chain security risks through automated SBOM analysis, vendor assessments, and NIST-aligned compliance frameworks.

assessments.title: Comprehensive Risk Assessments
assessments.description: Evaluate your supply chain security posture with industry-standard frameworks and automated analysis tools.

features.title: Powerful Supply Chain Security Features
features.description: Comprehensive tools designed to protect your organization from supply chain threats and ensure regulatory compliance.

feature1.title: Supply Chain Risk Assessment
feature1.description: NIST SP 800-161 aligned assessments to evaluate your supply chain security posture.

feature2.title: SBOM Analysis

feature3.title: Vendor Risk Management
feature3.description: Comprehensive vendor risk tracking with automated scoring and compliance monitoring.

feature4.title: Compliance Automation

stakeholders.title: Designed for Every Supply Chain Stakeholder
stakeholders.description: VendorSoluce addresses the unique challenges faced by different teams in your organization, providing tailored solutions that deliver measurable value to each stakeholder.

cta.description: Join organizations worldwide who trust VendorSoluce to secure their supply chains and meet compliance requirements.

challenges.lifecycle: Managing vendor relationships throughout their lifecycle
challenges.contracts: Ensuring contract terms include appropriate security clauses
challenges.diligence: Demonstrating due diligence for audit purposes

compliance.title: Compliance Officers

challenges.evolving: Keeping up with evolving regulatory requirements

reporting.title: Risk Reporting

cta.title: Start Securing Your Supply Chain Today
cta.description: Join thousands of organizations worldwide who trust VendorSoluce for their supply chain security needs.

assessment.title: Supply Chain Risk Assessment
assessment.subtitle: Evaluate your organization's supply chain security posture based on NIST SP 800-161

supplier.title: Supplier Risk Management
supplier.description: Assess your organization's approach to managing supplier-related risks

sr1.question: Does your organization have documented policies and procedures for supplier risk management?
sr1.guidance: This includes policies for supplier selection, evaluation, monitoring, and management throughout the relationship lifecycle.

sr2.question: Do you perform risk assessments of suppliers before establishing business relationships?
sr2.guidance: Risk assessments should evaluate supplier security practices, financial stability, and operational capabilities.

sr3.question: Are supplier contracts required to include security requirements and right-to-audit clauses?
sr3.guidance: Contracts should specify security requirements, compliance obligations, and provide audit rights.

sr4.question: Do you monitor suppliers on an ongoing basis for changes in risk profile?
sr4.guidance: Ongoing monitoring should include regular reassessments, security notifications, and performance reviews.

threat.title: Supply Chain Threat Management
threat.description: Evaluate your organization's capability to identify and respond to supply chain threats

tm1.question: Does your organization actively monitor for supply chain threats and vulnerabilities?
tm1.guidance: This includes monitoring threat intelligence feeds, vulnerability databases, and security advisories.

tm2.question: Do you have processes to validate the integrity and authenticity of received products/services?
tm2.guidance: Validation should include verification of product authenticity, integrity checks, and provenance tracking.

tm3.question: Are there documented procedures for responding to supply chain security incidents?
tm3.guidance: Procedures should cover incident detection, notification, containment, and recovery specific to supply chain events.

tm4.question: Do you share and receive threat intelligence with suppliers and industry partners?
tm4.guidance: Information sharing should include relevant threat indicators, attack patterns, and mitigation strategies.

vulnerability.title: Vulnerability Management
vulnerability.description: Assess your approach to managing vulnerabilities in supply chain components

vm1.question: Do you maintain software bills of materials (SBOMs) for critical systems and applications?
vm1.guidance: SBOMs should include all software components, versions, dependencies, and licensing information.

vm2.question: Are suppliers required to provide vulnerability notifications and security updates?
vm2.guidance: Requirements should include timely notification of vulnerabilities and provision of security patches.

vm3.question: Do you perform vulnerability scanning of supplier-provided software and systems?
vm3.guidance: Scanning should be performed before deployment and on an ongoing basis for continuous monitoring.

vm4.question: Is there a documented process for prioritizing and remediating supply chain vulnerabilities?
vm4.guidance: Process should include risk assessment, prioritization criteria, and remediation timelines.

information.title: Information Sharing
information.description: Evaluate information sharing practices with supply chain partners

is1.question: Do you have formal agreements for sharing security information with key suppliers?
is1.guidance: Agreements should define what information is shared, how it's protected, and usage restrictions.

is2.question: Are suppliers required to notify you of security incidents that could affect your organization?
is2.guidance: Notification requirements should include incident types, timeframes, and communication channels.

is3.question: Do you participate in industry information sharing organizations or communities?
is3.guidance: Participation may include ISACs, industry groups, or government information sharing initiatives.

is4.question: Is sensitive information properly classified and protected when shared with suppliers?
is4.guidance: Protection should include classification schemes, access controls, and handling requirements.

incident.title: Incident Response
incident.description: Assess your organization's incident response capabilities for supply chain events

ir1.question: Does your incident response plan specifically address supply chain security incidents?
ir1.guidance: Plan should include procedures for supplier-related incidents, notification processes, and coordination mechanisms.

ir2.question: Are suppliers required to have incident response capabilities and plans?
ir2.guidance: Supplier requirements should include documented incident response procedures and testing requirements.

ir3.question: Do you conduct regular exercises or tests of supply chain incident response procedures?
ir3.guidance: Exercises should test coordination with suppliers, communication procedures, and recovery capabilities.

ir4.question: Is there a process for conducting post-incident reviews of supply chain security events?
ir4.guidance: Reviews should identify lessons learned, process improvements, and preventive measures.

lifecycle.title: Supplier Lifecycle Management
lifecycle.description: Evaluate management of suppliers throughout their relationship lifecycle

sl1.question: Do you have documented procedures for supplier onboarding that include security requirements?
sl1.guidance: Onboarding should include security assessments, contract negotiations, and baseline establishment.

sl2.question: Are suppliers regularly reassessed for security compliance and risk changes?
sl2.guidance: Reassessments should be risk-based with frequency determined by supplier criticality and risk level.

sl3.question: Do you have procedures for managing supplier relationship changes and terminations?
sl3.guidance: Procedures should address contract modifications, service transitions, and secure data return/destruction.

sl4.question: Is supplier performance monitored against defined security metrics and SLAs?
sl4.guidance: Monitoring should include security performance indicators, compliance metrics, and service level tracking.

sbom.title: SBOM Analyzer
sbom.description: Upload and analyze Software Bills of Materials to identify vulnerabilities, license issues, and compliance concerns in your software supply chain.

upload.title: Upload SBOM
upload.supportedFormats: Supports SPDX, CycloneDX, and plain text formats
upload.noSbom: Upload a SBOM file to get started
upload.uploadPrompt: Select a SBOM file to analyze for vulnerabilities and compliance issues.

vendorRisk.title: Vendor Risk Dashboard
vendorRisk.description: Monitor and manage third-party vendor risks with comprehensive assessment tools and real-time risk monitoring.

riskScoring.title: Risk Scoring Guide
riskScoring.description: Understanding how vendor risk scores are calculated and what they mean for your organization.

criticalRisk.title: Critical Risk Vendors
criticalRisk.description: Require immediate remediation or consideration of alternative vendors.

highRisk.title: High Risk Vendors
highRisk.description: Implement additional controls and increase monitoring frequency.

mediumRisk.title: Medium Risk Vendors
mediumRisk.description: Regular monitoring and periodic reassessment recommended.

lowRisk.title: Low Risk Vendors
lowRisk.description: Continue standard monitoring and annual reassessments.

dashboard.overview: Here's an overview of your supply chain security posture

sbomScan.title: SBOM Quick Scan
sbomScan.description: Rapidly scan Software Bills of Materials for immediate security insights and vulnerability identification.
sbomScan.scanComplete: Scan complete! Your SBOM has been analyzed.
sbomScan.noVulnerabilities: No critical vulnerabilities detected in your SBOM.
sbomScan.formatInfo: Upload SPDX, CycloneDX, or plain text component lists for instant analysis.

riskCalculator.title: Vendor Risk Calculator
riskCalculator.description: Calculate preliminary vendor risk scores using standardized assessment criteria to support procurement decisions.
riskCalculator.step1: Enter the vendor name you want to assess
riskCalculator.step2: Rate each risk factor on a scale of 1-5
riskCalculator.step3: Click calculate to get an immediate risk score
riskCalculator.disclaimer: This calculator provides preliminary risk estimates. Conduct full assessments for critical vendors.

dataAccess.name: Data Access Level
dataAccess.description: Level of access to sensitive data or systems

criticality.name: Business Criticality
criticality.description: How critical this vendor is to business operations

securityControls.name: Security Controls
securityControls.description: Quality and maturity of vendor's security controls

compliance.name: Compliance Status
compliance.description: Vendor's compliance with relevant standards and regulations

systemExposure.name: System Exposure
systemExposure.description: Level of integration with internal systems

results.low: This vendor presents low risk. Standard monitoring procedures are sufficient.
results.medium: This vendor presents moderate risk. Enhanced monitoring and regular assessments recommended.
results.high: This vendor presents high risk. Implement additional controls and frequent monitoring.
results.critical: This vendor presents critical risk. Immediate action required - consider alternative vendors.

nistChecklist.title: NIST 800-161 Checklist
nistChecklist.description: Quick compliance check against NIST SP 800-161 supply chain risk management controls for rapid assessment.
nistChecklist.instructions: Review each control and mark whether your organization has implemented it. This provides a quick compliance overview.
nistChecklist.compliantMessage: Your organization shows strong alignment with NIST SP 800-161 controls.
nistChecklist.nonCompliantMessage: Consider conducting a full assessment to identify improvement areas.
nistChecklist.aboutText1: NIST Special Publication 800-161 provides guidance for managing cyber supply chain risks in federal information systems and organizations.
nistChecklist.aboutText2: This checklist covers key control areas to help you quickly assess your current compliance posture.

items.scrm1: Establish supply chain risk management policy and procedures
items.scrm2: Designate supply chain risk management officials
items.scrm8: Create supply chain incident response procedures
items.scrm10: Conduct regular program reviews and updates

pricing.title: Choose Your Plan
pricing.subtitle: Select the perfect plan for your organization's supply chain security needs, with flexible options from startups to enterprises.

starter.name: Starter
starter.description: Perfect for small organizations getting started with supply chain risk management

professional.name: Professional
professional.description: Comprehensive features for growing organizations with multiple vendors and compliance requirements

enterprise.name: Enterprise
enterprise.description: Advanced features for large organizations with complex supply chains and regulatory requirements

federal.name: Federal
federal.description: Specialized solution for federal agencies and contractors with enhanced security and compliance features

features.predictiveAnalytics: Predictive risk analytics and machine learning
features.supplyChainMapping: Multi-tier supply chain mapping and visualization

freeTrial.question: Do you offer a free trial?
freeTrial.answer: Yes, we offer a 14-day free trial for all paid plans. No credit card required to get started.

changePlans.question: Can I change my plan later?
changePlans.answer: Absolutely! You can upgrade or downgrade your plan at any time. Changes take effect immediately.

paymentMethods.question: What payment methods do you accept?
paymentMethods.answer: We accept all major credit cards, ACH transfers, and purchase orders for enterprise customers.

dataSecure.question: How secure is my data?
dataSecure.answer: Your data is encrypted at rest and in transit. We maintain SOC 2 Type II certification and are FedRAMP authorized.

customIntegrations.question: Do you offer custom integrations?
customIntegrations.answer: Yes, our Enterprise and Federal plans include custom integrations and dedicated API support.

supportIncluded.question: What support is included?
supportIncluded.answer: All plans include email support. Professional plans add priority support, and Enterprise plans include phone support and dedicated success managers.

about.title: About VendorSoluce

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: A world where organizations can confidently manage their supply chain risks with powerful yet simple tools.

securityFirst.title: Security First
securityFirst.description: We believe in security by design, not as an afterthought.

excellence.title: Excellence
excellence.description: We strive for excellence in all we do, from product quality to customer support.

integrity.title: Integrity
integrity.description: We build trust through transparency, honest communication, and doing what's right.

team.description: We're always looking for talented individuals passionate about security and building great products.

authentication.description: All API requests require authentication using API keys. Include your API key in the Authorization header.

securityTips.clientSide: Never expose API keys on the client side
